metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23214 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: When the server is configured to use trust authentication with a clientcert requirement or to use cert authentication, a man-in-the-middle attacker can inject arbitrary SQL queries when a connection is first established, despite the use of SSL certificate verification and encryption.

notes.Note: leosilva> PostgreSQL 9.3 is end of life upstream, and no updates are are available. Marking as deferred in -esm-main releases. mdeslaur> Plan is for postgresql-13 to be removed from jammy, marking as deferred for now.

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.1: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
postgresql-9.3 package in trusty is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2019-08-23').
